alert.note: Alert for Bledsoe; Blount Smoky Mountains; Bradley; East Polk; Hamilton; Knox; Loudon; Marion; McMinn; Meigs; NW Blount; Northwest Monroe; Rhea; Roane; Sequatchie; Southeast Monroe; West Polk (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 23 at 5:54AM CST until February 24 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST/8 AM CST/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following areas, Bledsoe, Blount Smoky Mountains, Bradley, East Polk, Hamilton, Knox, Loudon, Marion, McMinn, Meigs, Northwest Blount, Northwest Monroe, Rhea, Roane, Sequatchie, Southeast Monroe and West Polk. * WHEN...Until 9 AM EST/8 AM CST/ this morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Light to moderate rain will continue for the next couple of hours, especially south of Interstate 40 and along or east of Interstate 75. Any additional rainfall will immediately become runoff, which will only lengthen any ongoing flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Bledsoe; Blount Smoky Mountains; Bradley; East Polk; Hamilton; Knox; Loudon; Marion; McMinn; Meigs; NW Blount; Northwest Monroe; Rhea; Roane; Sequatchie; Southeast Monroe; West Polk
